review.title: Decision-theoretic rough sets-based three-way approximations of interval-valued fuzzy sets
review.abstract: In practical situations, interval-valued fuzzy sets are frequently encountered. In this paper, firstly, we present shadowed sets for interpreting and understanding interval fuzzy sets. We also provide an analytic solution to computing the pair of thresholds by searching for a balance of uncertainty in the framework of shadowed sets. Secondly, we construct errors-based three-way approximations of interval-valued fuzzy sets. We also provide an alternative decision-theoretic formulation for calculating the pair of thresholds by transforming interval-valued loss functions into single-valued loss functions, in which the required thresholds are computed by minimizing decision costs. Thirdly, we compute errors-based three-way approximations of interval-valued fuzzy sets by using interval-valued loss functions. Finally, we employ several examples to illustrate that how to take an action for an object with interval-valued membership grade by using interval-valued loss functions.

sections.text: ar Xiv: 141 2,69 73v1 [cs.AI] 22 In this paper, we first present shadow sets for interpreting and understanding interval fuzzy sets. We also offer an analytical solution for calculating the threshold pair by looking for a balance of uncertainty within shadow sets. Secondly, we construct error-based three-way approximations of interval fuzzy sets. Thirdly, we offer an alternative decision-based three-way approximation of interval-weighted fuzzy sets by transforming interval-weighted loss functions into single-value loss functions, in which the required thresholds are calculated by minimizing decision costs. Thirdly, we compute error-based three-way approximations of interval-weighted fuzzy sets by using interval-weighted loss functions. Finally, we use several examples to illustrate how to perform an action on an object with interval-weighted membership class by using interval-weighted loss functions.
